data.title: Tyler Perry Makes History As the First African American to Own 2 Major Television Networks, Netizens Inspired
data.meta_description: Tyler Perry is now officially the first African American to own two major television networks. He purchased BET and VH1, and has left many people inspired.
data.text:
Tyler Perry has made history by being the first black person to own two major television networks

The actor and filmmaker purchased BET and VH1, making him the first media personality to do so

Netizens have congratulated Tyler Perry on this massive achievement and have even made him the face of black excellence

Congratulations go out to Tyler Perry for having bought BET and VH1.

Netizens were left proud of the legendary actor and filmmaker for this significant achievement.

Tyler Perry now owns BET and VH1, makes history

The man who brought Mabel "Madea" Simmons into people's homes has now made history for being the first African American to own BET and VH1.

Dineo Ranaka congratulates Tyler Perry, said she is inspired

Tyler Perry received many congratulatory messages from people, including South Africa's Dineo Ranaka. The former radio presenter lauded Tyler for being the epitome of black excellence and an inspiration for her.

Taking to her Instagram page, Dineo wrote:

"More news on black people doing insanely amazing things!!! I am beyond inspired by them!! Imagine owning BET & VH1."

Tyler Perry finalised a deal to buy BET Media Group and VH1

In a previous report from Legit.ng, Tyler Perry wowed internet users after he finalised the agreement to purchase Bet Media Group and VH1.

He was competing against other media moguls, Puff Daddy and Curtis '50 Cent' Jackson.

Many viewers were left unimpressed, with others targeting his movies and other productions.
